org.csstudio.platform.internal.management
Class ManagementServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.platform.internal.management.ManagementServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IManagementCommandService
public class ManagementServiceImpl
extends Object
implements IManagementCommandService

Implements the Management Command Service based on the managementCommands extension point. This implementation makes available all commands registered as extensions of that extension point.

Note that this service is not a remote service. For remote administration, this service must be pubished as a remote service by another plug-in.

Author:
Joerg Rathlev

getSupportedCommands

public CommandDescription[] getSupportedCommands()
Returns the commands supported by this service.

Specified by:
getSupportedCommands in interface IManagementCommandService
Returns:
the commands supported by this service.

execute

public CommandResult execute(String commandId,
                             CommandParameters parameters)
Executes the specified command.

Specified by:
execute in interface IManagementCommandService
Parameters:
commandId - the identifier of the command to execute.
parameters - the parameters for the command. May be null to call the command without parameters.
Returns:
the result of the command execution. If the specified command is not supported by this service, a command result indicating an error is returned. If the execution of the command fails with an exception, a command result of type CommandResult.TYPE_EXCEPTION is returned with the exception as its payload.

getDynamicEnumerationValues

public CommandParameterEnumValue[] getDynamicEnumerationValues(String commandId,
                                                               String parameterId)
Returns the dynamic enumeration values for the specified command and paramter.

Specified by:
getDynamicEnumerationValues in interface IManagementCommandService
Parameters:
commandId - the identifier of the command.
parameterId - the identifier of the parameter.
Returns:
an array of enumeration values. If the specified command does not exist, or if the command does not have the specified parameter, or if the parameter is not a dynamic enumeration parameter, returns an empty array.
